meanings.sent1: She always forjudges people based on their appearance.
meanings.sent2: The teacher forjudges the students' abilities before they even start the class.
meanings.sent3: He forjudges the ending of the movie and always guesses wrong.
meanings.sent4: Her forjudging nature clouds her ability to see the truth.
meanings.sent5: Forjudging can lead to misunderstandings and unfair treatment.

meanings.definition: To form an opinion or decision before all the facts are known.
meanings.sent1: They forjudges the outcome of the game without considering all possibilities.
meanings.sent2: It's not fair to forjudges someone without hearing their side of the story.
meanings.sent3: He forjudges the taste of the food before even taking a bite.
meanings.sent4: Forjudging can sometimes save time, but it can also lead to mistakes.
meanings.sent5: She regrets forjudging the situation and jumping to conclusions too quickly.
